alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:26PM CDT until March 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR NEWTON...NORTHEASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHERN NESHOBA COUNTIES... At 426 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lawrence, or 8 miles east of Forest, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Lawrence around 430 PM CDT. Conehatta around 435 PM CDT. Decatur and Stratton around 450 PM CDT. Little Rock around 500 PM CDT. Duffee around 505 PM CDT. Herbert Springs and House around 510 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lake and Sebastopol. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and east central Mississippi. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
